greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of Dyck n-paths containing k even-length descents to ground level.
comment: Column k is the sum of columns 2k and 2k+1 of A106566.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for the first 76 rows, flattened
David Callan, The 136th manifestation of C_n , arXiv:math/0511010 [math.CO], 2005.
formula: G.f.=G(s,z)=1/[1-z(1+szC)/(1-z^2*C^2)], where C=[1-sqrt(1-4z)]/(2z) is the Catalan function.

The trivariate g.f. H(t,s,z), where t (s) marks odd-length (even-length) descents to ground level and z marks semilength, is H=1/[1-z(t+szC)/(1-z^2*C^2)], where C=[1-sqrt(1-4z)]/(2z) is the Catalan function. (End)
example: a(3,1)=3 because the Dyck 3-paths containing one even-length descent to ground level are UUDUDD, UDUUDD, UUDDUD.
mathematica: Join[{1}, Table[k/(n - k) Binomial[2 n - 2 k, n] + (2 k + 1)/(2 n - 2 k - 1) Binomial[2 n - 2 k - 1, n], {n, 25}, {k, 0, n/2}] // Flatten] (* _G. C. Greubel_, Jul 28 2017 *)
xref: Row sums are the Catalan numbers A000108.
A143949 considers odd-length descents to the ground level. - _Emeric Deutsch_, Oct 05 2008
results.author: _David Callan_, Nov 02 2005
